radiographic_examinations.findings: The liver appears normal in grayscale appearance, size, without focal lesion. There is no intrahepatic biliary ductal dilation. The common bile duct is normal in caliber measuring 3 mm. The main portal vein is patent with hepatopetal flow. Gallbladder is contracted around multiple shadowing stones with a wall-echo-shadow complex identified. The pancreas is suboptimally assessed and appears grossly unremarkable. Both kidneys appear normal in size without hydronephrosis or worrisome lesion. The spleen is not visualized.
